title: An Hour of Radio about Fonts
content: The Public Radio International program "To the Best of Our Knowledge" just did an hour on fonts. There were interviews with Jonathan Hoefler and Tobias Frere-Jones and with Matthew Carter. The program is online for a week at [http://wpr.org/book/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131120148/http:/wpr.org/book/).
author: Gerry K

comments.content: Argh. Any other file formats besides Real(ly annoying)Audio?
OK, really 45 minutes of radio about fonts, and 15 minutes of radio about how sad it is that kids don't learn [enough] handwriting anymore. :-[

Hey, 75% is still great!  
(Thanks Gerry.)

hhp

Sure 75% is good if you look at it that way, but why not make it 100%? Font coverage is hard enough to get, and rare enough; they wouldn't have to twist it all around in the end and conclude that really, handwriting is just so \*natural\* and \*personal\* and let's all write letters by hand now. It seems to give the preceding font talk sort of a weird aftertaste. But maybe that's just me.
VLC Player is good for handling Real files.

_Any other file formats?_

You can subscribe to an MP3 podcast at [http://www.npr.org/rss/podcast/podcast\_detail.php?siteId=4819402](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131120148/http:/www.npr.org/rss/podcast/podcast_detail.php?siteId=4819402)
